meanings.definition: A person or thing acting or serving in place of another.
meanings.sent1: In the play, one of the actors was unable to perform, so the substitutes took over.
meanings.sent2: During the soccer game, the coach called in substitutes to replace tired players.
meanings.sent3: The substitute teacher accidentally walked into the wrong classroom and started teaching math instead of English.
meanings.sent4: The cardboard cutout of the celebrity was a poor substitute for the real person at the event.
meanings.sent5: Having a backup generator is a good substitute for when the power goes out.

meanings.definition: To use or add in place of: substitute sugar for honey.
meanings.sent1: I had to substitutes butter with margarine in the recipe because I ran out.
meanings.sent2: When baking, you can substitute applesauce for oil to make the dish healthier.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to substitute salt with sugar in the dish, creating a surprisingly sweet flavor.
meanings.sent4: She had to substitute her usual route with a detour due to road construction.
meanings.sent5: In emergencies, you can substitute a flashlight for a candle to provide light.

meanings.definition: To replace (one or more elements or groups in a compound) by other elements or groups.
meanings.sent1: The chemist needed to substitutes chlorine for fluorine in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: When making a salad, you can substitute spinach for lettuce for a different taste.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to substitute the difficult question with an easier one during the test.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to substitute the old engine parts with new ones to fix the car.
meanings.sent5: You can substitute almond milk for regular milk in recipes if you are lactose intolerant.
